name: Series Convergence Tests
explanation: Convergence tests determine whether an infinite series converges (has a finite sum) or diverges. The ratio test compares consecutive terms: if the limit is < 1, series converges; if > 1, diverges; if = 1, test is inconclusive. The root test examines the nth root of terms. Other important tests include the integral test, comparison test, and alternating series test.
